snippet: Kurdish militants released eight Turks they had been holding hostage in the latest sign that peace talks between Turkey and Kurdish rebels were gaining momentum.
abstract: Kurdish militants release eight Turkish hostages, latest sign that peace talks between two sides are gaining momentum; hostages were abducted in 2011 and 2012 by Kurdistan Workers' Party.

byline.original: By SEBNEM ARSU and TIM ARANGO
byline.contributor: Sebnem Arsu reported from Antakya, Turkey, and Tim Arango from Baghdad. Ceylan Yeginsu contributed reporting from Antakya.

lead_paragraph: Kurdish militants released eight Turks they had been holding hostage in the latest sign that peace talks between Turkey and Kurdish rebels were gaining momentum.

headline.seo: Kurdish Rebels Release Turkish Captives, Fueling Peace Talks
headline.main: Kurdish Rebels Free 8 Turks, Fueling Peace Talks
headline.print_headline: Kurdish Rebels Free 8 Turks, Fueling Peace Talks
